comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of November 22, 1944 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0A13F83555157B... (needs subscription) has a shorter obituary. Barton invented the obstetrical forceps and skul tongs for treatment of dislocation of the cervical spine.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I think both those articles are about Lyman Barton, Sr. I'm guessing this fellow with the dog is: www.edwardbarton.org/i0008793.htm#i8793 In 1915: "Occupation - Surgeon at Massachusetts General Hospital specializing in afflictions of the nose and throat - 1913-1924 - Boston, Suffolk Co., MA, USA" www.bartondatabase.info/getperson.php?personID=I19572&...
